topics.body:
"@PaskaNaakka":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/549a8fc56368724d56de0300#post_549a8fc56368724d56de0300
If I had to take a guess why people think my personality is weird is that the best explanation is that I'm a incomplete personality.  Imagine if you had something broken and you fixed it by throwing out all the broken things until it eventually worked.  Simply put if you ask something along the lines of why say for instance my favorite color would be the combination of black and white in exact equal quantities in either symmetry or complex patterns I simply couldn't tell you cause there is no reason or logic as to why because while there is no logical reason why there is neither a illogical reason as to why not; trying to find logic or illogic there is like trying to find the mass of hypothetical earth's second moon and arguing about it, in any case there is no second earth moon therefore trying to find the mass of it is pointless.

topics.body: Why is "character's life is saved by another character who they then are indebted to but they annoy the character that saved them so much that the character comes up with a plan to fake the other character saving their life to repay the debt but the plan falls apart and they actually end up saving that character's life" a plot in so many cartoons? It's like writers all share a big jar of emergency scripts for when they forgot to make an episode.
